item.title: Presentation: preregRS guides preregistration
item.description: In this presentation on the Research Synthesis & Big Data Conference I introduced preregRS: An R Markdown template to preregister research syntheses. The template is available in RStudio after installing the R package preregRS. It is intended to guide the preregistration process and enable compatibility (e.g. to include analysis code, results, embed PDFs, plots). Click this link to download the presentation. item.title: Less quantity, more quality? Student teachers’ analyses of classroom videos and the influence of problem-based and direct instructional teaching approaches
item.description: Authors Jürgen Schneider Marc Kleinknecht Thorsten Bohl Sebastian Kuntze Markus Rehm Marcus Syring Abstract This paper investigates the effects of different case-based learning approaches (problem-based vs. direct instructional) and the instructors’ attitude on student teachers’ analyses of classroom management. We assigned 638 student teachers from 21 identical professional development courses to one of the two case-based learning conditions. Student teachers’ analyses were evaluated on selective attention, reflective thought, and theory-practice integrations in a pre-post-design.

item.title: (Re)Building Trust? Journals’ Open Science Badges Influence Trust in Scientists.
item.description: Authors Jürgen Schneider Tom Rosman Augustin Kelava Samuel Merk Abstract As a response to the replication crisis, reforms call for the implementation of open science standards. In this regard, open science badges are a promising method to signal a study’s adherence to open science practices (OSP). In an experimental study, we investigated whether badges on journal article title pages affect non-scientists’ trust in scientists. Furthermore, we analyzed the moderating role of epistemic beliefs in this regard.

item.title: New Preprint: Effects of Open Science Badges on Trust in Scientists
item.description: Access Check out the preprint on PsyArXiv or the project on the Open Science Framework! Abstract The Replication Crisis diminishes trust in empirical sciences and with it the perceived value of science (Lupia, 2018). Open Science Practices (i.a. open data, open analysis script, open materials) are an increasingly popular approach to deal with challenges in replication and to rebuilt trust (Geukes, Schönbrodt, Utesch, Geukes, & Back, 2016). First investigations could, however, deliver no evidence toward the effects of Open Science Practices (OSP) on trustworthiness (Wingen, Berkessel, & Englich, 2019).

item.title: Relationierung von Theorie Und Praxis: Was Bedeutet Dieses Konzept Für Die Begleitung von Praktika in Der Lehrerinnen- Und Lehrerbildung?
item.description: Authors Jürgen Schneider Colin Cramer Abstract Im Beitrag wird das Konzept der Relationierung von Theorie und Praxis ausgehend vom strukturtheoretischen Professionsansatz diskutiert. Dabei wird das Konzept mit der Hybridität zweier Praxen verbunden und dessen Konsequenzen für die Lehrer*innenbildung werden nachgezeichnet. Im Sinne der Einlassung und Distanz auf beide Praxen eröffnet das Konzept eine konstruktive Perspektive auf den Umgang mit Wissenschaftspraxis und Schulpraxis im Rahmen der Qualifikation von Lehrpersonen – besonders in schulpraktischen Phasen.

item.title: The Crowdsourced Replication Initiative: Investigating Immigration and Social Policy Preferences. Executive Report.
item.description: Authors Nate Breznau Eike Mark Rinke Alexander Wuttke … Jürgen Schneider … Abstract In an era of mass migration, social scientists, populist parties and social movements raise concerns over the future of immigration-destination societies. What impacts does this have on policy and social solidarity? Comparative cross-national research, relying mostly on secondary data, has findings in different directions. There is a threat of selective model reporting and lack of replicability.
